page.title: 17HINXWORTH'S SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Since we are a rural community most of the things which concern us are to do in some way with the environment.Every year tempers are roused when the straw {stubble is burnt off}resulting in the pollution of the atmosphere, the destruction of trees and hedges by "accident", and black smuts in many houses. Another thing which people are becoming increasingly worried about is the proliferation of the{aerial spray- {ing}of crops with dangerous chemicals causing damage to wildlife and people who inadvertently come into contact. Again there is the tendency of farmers to grub up{hedges and footpaths}to make fields larger and easier to man- age for large machinery.The other main concern we have in the village is the lack of a{speed limit}which has resul- ted in the death of one young boy; we have campaigned to no avail as yet.
